Ken, Jason and David,
 
Thanks for the new paper.  This is very powerful stuff.
 
Ken
 
=============================
Kenneth A. Lloyd
CEO and Director of Systems Science
Watt Systems Technologies Inc.
Albuquerque, NM USA
kenneth.lloyd@...
kenneth.lloyd@...  - MBSE Complex, Adaptive & Stochastic Systems
kenneth.lloyd@...    - Director of Education
www.wattsys.com <http://www.wattsys.com/> 
 
 <http://www.linkedin.com/pub/7/9a/824> http://www.linkedin.com/pub/7/9a/824

 
This e-mail is intended only for the addressee named above. It may contain
privileged or confidential information.
If you are not the addressee you must not copy, distribute, disclose or use
any of the information in it. 
If you have received it in error please delete it and immediately notify the
sender.



  _____  

From: neat@yahoogroups.com [mailto:neat@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Kenneth Stanley
Sent: Wednesday, August 27, 2008 11:41 PM
To: neat@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [neat] New Artificial Life Journal Maniscript on HyperNEAT



I've decided to post the manuscript for a fairly comprehensive journal
article on HyperNEAT that will be coming out in 2009 in Arficial Life
journal (Artificial Life journal has a long backup of articles). One
reason for the timing is that I will be giving a keynote talk about
HyperNEAT at the International Conference on Neural Networks (ICANN)
in Prague next week, and I felt it would be good to have this more
comprehensive reference available for that. If you happen to be going
to ICANN, I will be giving the talk on the last day at 9-10am.

The article is a detailed synthesis of the work of David D'Ambrosio,
Jason Gauci, and myself from 2007. However, it goes into greater
depth and includes a lot more HyperNEAT pattern visualization and
analysis than the conference papers. People in this group interested
in HyperNEAT may in particular find the visualizations intuitively
interesting. 

The 39-page paper is called, "A Hypercube-Based Indirect Encoding for
Evolving Large-Scale Neural Networks," and is available here:

http://eplex. <http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/publications.html#stanley.alife09>
cs.ucf.edu/publications.html#stanley.alife09

ken
